[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Enterprise Email System (EES) document defines requirements for secure and reliable email services.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: EES supports executive branch email operations with centralized management and compliance enforcement.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: EES integrates with agency IT systems for email and data exchange.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: EES provides centralized dashboards for email and contact management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: EES supports servers and network infrastructure.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: EES integrates with antivirus and spam filters.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: EES uses secure protocols like TCP/IP and TLS.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: EES is optimized for high-volume email storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: EES is configurable for agency needs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: EES connects with disaster recovery solutions.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: EES provides secure email, calendaring, and contact management.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: EES is for state employees, IT teams, and admins.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: EES depends on network stability and compliance.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: EES assumes operational IT infrastructure and agency-wide adoption.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Disaster Recovery: Restoring email after failure.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with agency IT applications for email and calendaring.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall support secure protocols for encrypted email.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall provide secure email, calendaring, and contact management (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall enable disaster recovery (REQ-ATTR-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall support email archiving per retention policies (REQ-DSGN-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive email interface.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall support multilingual options.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process email deliveries promptly under normal load conditions.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support up to a few dozen,000 concurrent users without degradation.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The database shall securely store email, calendaring, and contact data with encryption.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall enforce role-based access control for protecting sensitive information.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall follow a modular architecture to support scalability and future enhancements.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The software shall comply with federal and state data protection laws.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with state IT security standards and adhere to FOIA and GDPR compliance regulations.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall dynamically scale based on workload demands.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall log and audit all critical actions for security and compliance tracking.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Testing will validate email security, encryption, and performance.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals and system training guides.
[SEC] 5. References: State IT security policies, FOIA, and GDPR compliance.
